content: silksong flea by octogus i ve never posted a pattern before and this isn t tested or anything i just noted down what i did as i made the flea i hope everything is understandable but reach out and i ll try to help if something is unclear us terms do not slip_stitch or chain at the end of any round i used a 3 mm hook _________________________________________________________________________ abbreviations magic_ring = magic_ring chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet tc = treble_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch st = stitch increase = increase 2 single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease i use the invisible decrease technique blo = back loop only x n = whatever is inside brackets is repeated n times = indicates whatever is inside is worked into the same stitch = number of stitches at the end of the round _________________________________________________________________________ base with beige yarn magic_ring round 1 6 single_crochet 6 round 2 6 increase 12 round 3 increase single_crochet x 6 18 round 4 increase 2 single_crochet x 6 24 round 5 increase 3 single_crochet x 6 30 round 6 increase 4 single_crochet x 6 36 round 7 increase 5 single_crochet x 6 42 finish off _________________________________________________________________________ main body with beige yarn round 1 6 single_crochet 6 round 2 6 increase 12 round 3 increase single_crochet x 6 18 round 4 increase 2 single_crochet x 6 24 round 5 and 6 24 single_crochet around 24 round 7 increase 3 single_crochet x 6 30 round 8 30 single_crochet around 30 round 9 increase 4 single_crochet x 6 36 round 10 increase 5 single_crochet x 6 42 round 11 this is the round where you make the fluff flaps that stick out of the sides so it s a bit more complex 8 single_crochet **7 single_crochet turn 7 single_crochet blo outside loop on the 7sc you just made turn on the 7 single_crochet do half_double_crochet tc tc half_double_crochet slip_stitch double_crochet 2 tc double_crochet slip_stitch half_double_crochet tc tc half_double_crochet ** continuing back on the stitches of the previous row do 7 single_crochet repeat the part between ** ** continuing back on the stitches of the previous row do 13 single_crochet 42 st worked on the stitches of the previous row but you should have gone back 7 stitches and created a scalloped shape on those twice round 12 42 single_crochet around the stitches under the fluff flaps will be worked only on the loop that was left from doing the blo single_crochet on the previous round round 13-18 42 single_crochet around round 19 42 single_crochet around working through both the stitches of the previous round and the outside of the separate base piece for each stitch to join them the 42 stitches on both pieces should line up stuff before working the last few pieces to close round 20 decrease 5sc x 6 36 round 21 double_crochet tc chain
